Remarks.Recommendations: Initial screening may be negative in early primary syphilis. If there is strong clinical history suggestive of syphilis risk, please do a RPR test and/or repeat VD screening in 3 to 4 weeks' time. Please consult our doctor for further medical advices.
This indicates a likelihood for an active syphilis infection. Please consult our doctor for further advice on treatment.

Your tests most likely indicate a false positive VDRL result. If there is strong clinical history suggestive of syphilis risk, please do a RPR test and/or repeat VD screening in 3 to 4 weeks' time. Please consult our doctor for further medical advices.

Your VDRL and TPPA are both reactive, however your VDRL (RPR) is weak reactive which is indicative of a serofast state. These findings are likely indicative of previously treated syphilis. Please consult our doctor for further medical advice if you have symptoms.

Your tests most likely indicate a false positive VDRL result. If there is strong clinical history suggestive of syphilis risk, please do a RPR test and/or repeat VD screening in 3 to 4 weeks' time. Please consult our doctor for further medical advices.

Your VDRL and TPPA are both reactive, however your VDRL (RPR) is non-reactive. These findings are likely indicative of previously treated syphilis. Please consult our doctor for further medical advice if you have symptoms.

Your tests most likely indicate a false positive VDRL result. If there is strong clinical history suggestive of syphilis risk, please do a RPR test and/or repeat VD screening in 3 to 4 weeks' time. Please consult our doctor for further medical advices.
Your HIV antibodies test is indeterminate. Please consult our doctor for further medical advice.
A repeat test (chargeable) is recommended. Please consult our doctor for further medical advice.

You have a chlamydia infection that requires treatment. If left untreated, chlamydia may progress to serious damage of the reproductive organs along with other health problems. Please consult our doctor for further medical advice.

You have a gonorrhoea infection that requires treatment. If left untreated, gonorrhoea can cause serious damage of the reproductive organs along with other health problems. Please consult our doctor for further medical advice.

STD.Parameter: Herpes Simplex Virus Type I IgG

Remarks.Recommendations: You had a Herpes Simplex Virus (HSV) Type I infection. However, your viral load is low. A repeat test is recommended to rule out false positive results. Please consult our doctor for further medical advice.
You had a Herpes Simplex Virus (HSV) Type I infection that may require treatment. Please consult our doctor for further medical advice.

STD.Parameter: Herpes Simplex Virus Type II IgG

Remarks.Recommendations: You had a Herpes Simplex Virus (HSV) Type II infection. However, your viral load is low. A repeat test is recommended to rule out false positive results. Please consult our doctor for further medical advice.
You had a Herpes Simplex Virus (HSV) Type II infection that may require treatment. Please consult our doctor for further medical advice.
